message: We made it to the Fish Scale Inn, staggering with exhaustion after a day that was just too damn busy.

name: Gardner
message: Jeez, what a day it's been.
It's tough for an old person like me.
Gardner looks like he's gotten a lot older.
Even Thomas doesn't seem to have the energy to talk back right now.

name: Cordelia
message: We're done for today, right？
I'm heading back to the Gilman House.

name: Jonathan
message: You don't have to rush that much, do you？
Why　don't　you　stay　and　have　dinner　with　us?

name: Cordelia
message: Nah, I'll pass.
I'm kind of tired, so I don't have an appetite.

name: Jonathan
message: Is that so？
Lately, it seems like there aren't many customers coming to eat at the Fish Scale Inn, so if you went along, the lady would be happy too.

name: Cordelia
message: I'm sorry.
By the way, Jonathan......

name: Gardner
message: What's up, Jonathan.
Standing　around　here　isn't　going　to　get　you　anything.

name: Thomas
message: Are you lost in thought again？
If you're that uptight, the young lady's gonna end up hating you.　　　　　　A man needs to be a lot more chill, you know.
Walking along with these two loudmouths is no ordinary hassle.
It'd be nice if Cordelia could understand the tough spot I'm in too...
It's in front of the Fish Scale Inn.
Since it's early morning, it's dark outside. I have a feeling it's going to be a gloomy, overcast day again.
この村に来てから、まだ一度も晴天の空を見た事がないが、この時期のイギリスにあってはそれも仕方のない事なのだろう。

name: Cordelia
message: What's wrong？
You’ve been completely silent for a while now.

name: Thomas
message: There's nothing to worry about, miss.
This guy's always like this.
Looking at the Fish Scale Inn like this, it reminds me of what the station staff said back in Salem.
駅員は村で信用がおける宿はここしかないと言っていたが、確かにそのとおりかもしれない。少なくともハドスン夫人は夜中に客の部屋に忍び込んで手荷物を漁るような事はすまい。
It's the Fish Scale Inn.
In the middle of all the closed buildings around, it's the only one that's barely still open.
When I saw it in the darkness of night, it felt reliable, being the only thing left to depend on in this village, but now, seeing it under the sunlight like this, it just looks really unreliable.
It looks like they're trying to open up to us, but so far it doesn't seem like there have been any promising results.
He still doesn't seem used to being with Gardner and Thomas.
No wonder, Gardner might seem like a kindly old gentleman, but you never know when he might just explode in a fit of temper.
When it comes to Thomas, there's honestly no telling who the hell he even is.
Was it really a mistake to bring her along after all?
You probably shouldn't trust it too much.
As usual, acting nonchalant.
The way he sometimes exchanges glances with Cordelia so subtly that I can't tell, that's just like this untrustworthy guy.
But I don't think this guy's true face is just that of a mere dilettante.
Soon enough, they'll definitely start showing their true colors.
Seems like they're irritated.
We should probably leave before Gardner throws a tantrum.
At first glance, they seem calm on the outside, but inside, they can barely stand it—they're itching to uncover the mystery of the Ruins right away.
If he could successfully unravel the mysteries of the Arkham ruins, Gardner's status as a folklorist would become unshakable, and that's just how it is.

name: Cordelia
message: Jonathan, don't forget that promise, okay?

name: Jonathan
message: Promise？

name: Cordelia
message: Geez！
It's the same time as yesterday, don't forget.

name: Jonathan
message: Cordelia, aren't you tired？
Maybe we should stop here for today.

name: Cordelia
message: I'm still okay, but my head's kinda messed up.　　　　　　　　The more I look into it, the less I understand.

name: Jonathan
message: I can't deny that I kinda feel that way too.
I'm　starting　to　get　a　little　fed　up　too.

name: Cordelia
message: By the way......

name: Jonathan
message: What is it？

name: Cordelia
message: Will you come see me again tonight？

name: Jonathan
message: What are you saying all of a sudden, the professors are watching, you know.

name: Cordelia
message: Jonathan, please.
Come　again　tonight...　at　the　same　time　as　yesterday.

name: Cordelia
message: Marsh-san's story, it was full of things that are just really hard to believe, huh.

name: Jonathan
message: Is that so？
To me, here in Arkham, nothing would seem strange, no matter what happened.

name: Cordelia
message: それは言い過ぎよ、わたしだってアーカムの住人なん　　　　　　　　ですからね。

name: Cordelia
message: Besides, Jonathan, it’s not like you have absolutely no ties to this village, right？

name: Cordelia
message: Let's hurry up and go.
You wanna catch Marsh-san before she drinks too much and totally loses it, right？

name: Jonathan
message: Are you really okay staying with us？
If you don't want to, it's totally fine to stop.

name: Cordelia
message: This is something I wished for myself.
You　don't　need　to　worry　about　Jonathan　at　all.

name: Jonathan
message: I hope you're not just putting on a brave face with those words.
Just like last night, it'll be a problem if you suddenly throw a tantrum out of nowhere.

name: Cordelia
message: Don't say such mean things.
If　that　happens,　I'll　get　Thomas　to　help　me！

name: Thomas
message: What did you say？
Weren't you just talking about me just now?

name: Jonathan
message: なんでもない。

name: Thomas
message: I'm really getting sick of this village.
I　wanna　hurry　back　to　London　already.

name: Thomas
message: Come to think of it, maybe there was no need for me to come along in the first place, huh.

name: Jonathan
message: What are you saying now, after all this time？

name: Jonathan
message: No one ever said they wanted you to come along from the start, did they?

name: Thomas
message: Was that really the case？

name: Jonathan
message: Yeah, that's right.
It's not too late even now, I honestly wouldn't mind at all if you stayed at the Fish Scale Inn, you know.

name: Thomas
message: ......When you put it like that, it kind of hurts, you know.
Makes me wanna go with you no matter what, out of pure stubbornness.

name: Gardner
message: It's getting more and more confusing.
I'll have to meet Old man Marsh again.

name: Gardner
message: I really can't make heads or tails of what that old man is saying.
What kind of connection could there possibly be between the ruins and these bizarre murders...

name: Gardner
message: Anyway, it looks like our only option is to check out the Archives.
Guess we've got no choice but to go along with Marsh for a while, huh？

name: Gardner
message: Might be about time for us to head out.
Sitting　around　speculating　isn't　going　to　get　us　anywhere.

name: Gardner
message: First off, let's meet that old man Marsh everyone's talking about.
He might know something about the young lady's background too.

name: Gardner
message: Anyway, as far as we know, he seems to be the oldest among Arkham's villagers.

name: Jonathan
message: Now that you mention it, I don't think I've seen any old men since coming to the village.

name: Gardner
message: That's right......
Being a fisherman is a dangerous and tough job, so it's reasonable to assume that villagers have a relatively short life span.

name: Jonathan
message: Still, not seeing a single person around seems a little hard to believe.

name: Gardner
message: If you say that, isn't it true that most of the villagers won't show themselves in front of us? They're probably all hiding somewhere.
Go inside

name: Cordelia
message: Geez！
It's the same time as yesterday, don't forget.

name: Jonathan
message: Cordelia, aren't you tired？
Maybe we should call it here for today.

name: Cordelia
message: I'm still okay, but my head's kind of spinning.　　　　　　　　Feels like the more I look into it, the less I understand what's going on.

name: Jonathan
message: I guess I kind of feel that way, too.
I'm　starting　to　get　a　little　fed　up　too.

Come tonight too......at the same time as yesterday.
